Reviews.Title: “Regal was surprisingly quiet, especially considering other reviews here.”
Reviews.Author: paulino636
Reviews.Content: A great place to stay, and would stay there again. The Regal Hotel was not at all what I was expecting after reading some of the negative reviews on TripAdvisor and other places. Many complained about the hotel’s night clubs’ noise reaching the upper floors, disturbing sleep. Well, truth be told, the real reason I decided to stay here was out of curiosity of seeing what those clubs were about. Getting to sleep would not be much of an issue though. Where I work, loud aircraft and unexpected explosions are quite normal, so a light bass thump is relatively benign for me. Ironically, I never made it to clubs, nor could I hear them. And this was on a Friday night. Check-in was fast and efficient, and the employees were easy on the eyes. The room was clean and comfortable. Hot water worked right away. Climate controls, no problem. Room smelled pleasant. On the negative side, it was a bit smaller than what I was expecting, and there was a small amount of mildew (see pic) on the shower tiles near the faucets. This area is very central. A grocery store (Spinneys) is nearby, and there is plenty of shopping within walking distance. The Al-Fahidi metro station is literally right outside the front door.

Reviews.Title: “big mistake to stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: miss rose a
Reviews.Content: we went in adha vacation i cannot describe what a disgusting hotel it is bad smell ,dirty rooms, bathrooms incredible towels yucck they didnot clean every day very noisy we didnot sleep from the sound of music from the bar we ask them to shift to the upper floor they didnot make any thing when u enter the hotel you will be choked by naughty girls all around smoking smell all over the place no arabic food only indian food .you will get only what u pay for ,with respect to its normal price u can find many hotels with same price but with more value . 1 thing is good which is the location near the metro station and there is super market u can go walking only the location out side hotel is good but every thing inside this hotel is digusting and terrible .

Reviews.Title: “Recent trip to Dubai”
Reviews.Author: junecrombie
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked as a package holiday with flights via the internet. Hotel is equivalent to travel lodge back home in the UK. Basic rooms. No team/coffee making facilities however. You get what you pay for. Chinese restaurant is the only option for half board. But the food was really good. Hotel has a club which is opened until the early hours of the morning so it is a little noisy. Also, there is a very busy street outside so watch out for cars. New metro station is right outside however which is a big plus for getting around.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: moscovite2011
Reviews.Content: Very save option in Dubai. Location of this hotel is nice, all tourist destinations are accesable by taxi. Metro station is very close. Staff is friendly and helpfull. Breakfast is not bad. Dinner a la carte is better. WiFi is free. Rooms are clean and big, but haven't been renovated for many years. Price is reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy, horrible place to stay, with cockroaches!”
Reviews.Author: Uzma A
Reviews.Content: After deciding to stay in dubai for a couple of nights we booked a stay in this hotel hoping it would be cheap and cheerful place not expecting much but a place to sleep and spend most of our time outdoors. Some points to note 1) Cockroach found in bed, 2) Music was not overly obtrusive in our room but the bass could be heard/felt everso slightly, so if you are a light sleeper as my husband is, it can be disturbing, but not too bad. 3) There was always noise outside our rooms of people walking passed and people coming in out of rooms at all hours. 4) Distinct smokey odour throughout the hotel I would definitley not recommend this place, as it felt mostly seedy. Even if I was only using the hotel to sleep and spending most of the time away from it. Would recomend to a group of lads, but definitely not for family or couples.

Reviews.Title: “Did not enjoy the stay at all”
Reviews.Author: shettymanohar
Reviews.Content: Well as i did not get booking in my usual hotel, i stayed in this place, and it was not a pleasent experience at all, the room service was terrible as there was limited staff, though the food quality was good but the service was'nt, standard rooms were also small in size, in all i would say that i would not prefer to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel, in my life time”
Reviews.Author: krishnavamsi1989
Reviews.Content: As I stayed few days only but felt awesome being dubai regal plaza, Impeccable service and hospitality made me feels comfortable and relaxed. The Regal Plaza, the business class, Tourist stay hotel that has everything a discerning guest could wish for both in luxury and comfort. The Hotel is less than a 10-minute walk from the Burjuman Mall to the center of the city. A good Place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “very Nice property”
Reviews.Author: kirtika88
Reviews.Content: I stayed at REGAL PLAZA,DUBAI twice.......we enjoyed a lot.......Room service is very good and restaurant is also very nice.......this is situated in the heart of Dubai......I am sure,we will remember the vacation we had there.......n it was overall very good experience............Rabeena

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY!!!”
Reviews.Author: Zayneel
Reviews.Content: We booked accommodation for 2 nights at the Regal plaza as our travel agent suggested it - little did we know that it would be the worst hotel that I’ve ever stayed in... The rooms were not bad but the bathroom was atrocious - stains everyone!!! but the worst was yet to come as I found a used condom packet under the bed - I was mortified!!! The staff know little English, so it’s hard to communicate to room service, front desk etc - I would suggest to everyone to avoid this hotel completely. Also there was this weird odour throughout the hotel - Location for good I guess

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay but beware of the housekeeping staff !!!”
Reviews.Author: Amitlapasia
Reviews.Content: We were a family of 4 adults and 1 child booked our package with JETESCAPES for 4N/5D and stayed at this hotel. The rooms were quite neat and comfortable. There was no problem in check in. The rooms in the rear side of the hotel are the noisiest cos of the night club on the mazanine floor. The breakfast was good but a very cramped coffee-shop in the entrance where the breakfast spread was kept. Most of us had to stand or wait for a table to sit and have our break fast. The only trouble was at the check out. The housekeeping staff had checked my room and had told me that the mini bar was the same as they had left and nothing was used and once we returned back after some shopping to leave, the front desk guy says that i have consumed one of the bar bottles and would be charged. This complain was there from quite a few room guests as most of them were checking out of the hotel and were clearing there bills. The housekeeping staff were least bothered and had a care a damn attitude towards the guest especially a lady who was their head and had checked the rooms.She claimed that once we left the room, we used the mini bar stuff. Ridiculous and horrible housekeeping staff. Some of their own staff also acknowledged our problems but they said that this usually happens. Rest the bed quality and cleanliness was good. The indian restaurant had great sheesha..

Reviews.Title: “Be very careful”
Reviews.Author: umesh_2us
Reviews.Content: The hotel is neat and clean but response of hotel staff depends on person to person on the front desk .If person is good you get good response .The hotel has poor house keeping facility .The hotel is not quiet place as daily there is a evening show .The sound disturbs you .

Reviews.Title: “Most probably the worst management and very close to the worst hotel ever encountered”
Reviews.Author: HectorR07
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in hotels all over the planet a, for the life of me I don't understand why this company is allowed to run hotels. Let me enumerate: I. The hotel is dirty Ii.the hotel stinks of cigarrete smoke Iii. Breakfast is digesting Iv. AC may or may not work or as it happened to me the AC burnt out V. Staff try the best but they have been totally abandoned by maanaagement that is more interested in the night club and pub Vi. A bottle of darkling mineral water 300ml will cost US$ 7 vii. Unless one asks for the return of the laundry this will not be forthcoming as they want a tip Viii. Only five channels work on the cable tv and often only three mind you if one counts the channels that reqpeat themselves then there are about thirty channels Ix. If one pays any money in advanced it is strongly suggested that they insist to see this being posted to the room as one may lose the receipt and they will not get out of the way and look for it X. Sleep is often interrupted by noise from the nigth club or the sound of horns in the middle of the night Xi. If one asks why is the price different for an item, the wait person may answer with a rather disconcerting "so what" Xii. With the exception of a few rusted out staff the kids try their best it is just that management is non existent So go at your own risk, there are dozen of hotels in the area that are better value for the service one receives in this hole.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond disgusting - will spoil your whole experience of Dubai.”
Reviews.Author: Seeyas00n
Reviews.Content: We are an easy going Aussie family but this place....Despite booking a triple room months ago, we (myself, husband and elderly mother in law) were given a tiny room with 3 pillows on a double bed. Upon protesting, staff grudgingly gave us another larger room but then rolled out a folding bed for my poor old mother in law. No water in the fridge, no drinks available on a 48 C day - forced to walk 20 minutes to buy bottled water. The pool was being repaired, as it has been for months according to one staff member. Mould in the bathroom, air conditioning that varied between non-operational and 10 degrees all evening.Had we not been exhauusted would have left immediately. BUT IT GOT WORSE - when helping my mother in law fold her bedding, the sheets were stained with blood that wasn't hers!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Filthy place!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located, good for short stay”
Reviews.Author: SubsIndia
Reviews.Content: Had come on a personal visit, with wife, teenager son and another couple. Had opted for this, as suggested by a friend, mainly for location. Could not get any service appt in Bur Dubai, for the same duration. Check staff were quite un-friendly, all along. But, room service, and other room related, very friendly & courteous staff. The lobby was quite noisy and cluttered. Food quality good, I would prefer 'great'! The location is very good, either for evening shopping or early morning walk

Reviews.Title: “Please do not stay here if you wish to relax”
Reviews.Author: manc07Manchester
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a joke. A very unclean hotel. The rooms are tired, unclean and basic. I guess you get what you pay for.....is the saying. No, i am sorry. There are plenty of hotels in Dubai for the same price and alot of them are giving you a much better service than this one. The floors of the dinning area were still dirty from the day before, we noticed. Well your not eatting your breakfast off the floor you may say....but try finding a clean table either!! Outside by the pool, there are photos from the website of a beautiful relaxing area. Not so. Dirty, unloved and just not what the pics show. White plastic chairs that look like they have come out of the trash or bin!! The pool was sooooo small. And it had not been cleaned for months. The barbeque area was a dump!! The gym had so much dust on the equipment it was hard to find the instructions for use.....and you wouldnt want to use incase they blew up!!! The hotel has a night club within it, it starts at 12 midnight and ends at 4am, so dont expect any sleep. No matter where you are in the hotel you WILL BE KEPT AWAKE BY THE NOISE!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, some staff require training on customer service”
Reviews.Author: balster
Reviews.Content: The taxi driver had no problem finding the hotel. We got to the hotel about 6 hours before check-in, the lad on reception would not let us check in early or use any bathroom facilities - rubbish service here, considering we had been traveling on an overnight flight that took 8 hours and we were both very tired. But they did lock our suitcases away. We got back later and got to the hotel and our suitcases were left outside in the foyer next to the entrance!!! Anyone could have taken them - rubbish. Check in was swift and they gave us some fruit juice when we checked in. We specifically asked for a room on one of the top floors - we had read reviews about the noise coming from the night club on the 1st floor. And they gave us a room on the 6th floor. The baggage lad was very friendly and did his best with our suitcases. Our room was ok, big room, loads of space, nice firm bed, the air con was spot on. And during the nights we could not hear a thing - brilliant. My wife noticed that the mini bar was missing some items, so I notified reception to ensure that we did not get charged, and the lady on reception noted this. Our room could have done with a good vac, I found a dead beetle ext to the curtain. The shower room was an interesting place, nice and clean, very bright. There was a drain that water from the water hose went down, this drain had flies coming out of it - I just killed them and it was ok. The toilet flush was not very powerful, so I just used the water hose next to the toilet in the toilet. On one night the hot water system for the entire hotle stopped working, but this was fixed the next day at 10am. The electric plugs will give you a fright - I managed to get sparks coming out of one, when trying to recharge our camera. I phone housekeeping and they were up in 5 mins to show me how the plugs worked. The location off this hotel is fantastic. Only 5 mins walk to one of the main underground stations, which take you all over Dubai. Only 5 mins to the Burjman shopping centre. There are loads of small good value shopping centers all within 5 minutes walk. They were building another underground station right outside the hotel. The Indian area is only about 10 mins walk away - loads of bargains. 15 mins walk to the creek. We found that if you speak the lingo, then you get more attention. It's really a hotel run by asians, for asians. The breakfast was okish, just make sure you get there early, one the food has gone, they don't bring any more out. The bar on the ground floor was excellent - cheap food and drink and they had Sky. The nightclub on the 1st floor was an eyeopener. Some interesting ladies coming and going. But form what I could see, the club was a dive. There is a guy in the foyer who sells excursion tickets, eg desert safari. Barter HARD with him to get the price that YOU want to pay, we booked all of our trips with him including a day trip to the capital. The swimming pool (or big bath) looked dodgy. Overall, we had a good stay in the hotel, it was quiet and secure. I would recommend this hotel to a friend, just bear in mind that it's not the Ritz. You get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Deva_9
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located just bang opposite to the mall. The hotel is good, economical and well located. Also with the new metro it would be a good place. Rooms are decent and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Mo_Roy150
Reviews.Content: I was quite worried after reading some of the reviews on this site as I'd already booked the hotel but please don’t be put off. I am a 26 year old female and I stayed here with my mum and Gran and we really enjoyed our stay. Room - was large and clean, bed was massive, queen size I think. The room was a double supreme, and they were going to put in a another single bed but the bed was more than large enough for three. Nice big flat screen TV with a range of satellite channels. Plenty of cupboard space. Breakfast - there is a good spread of food, they always have English fry up items, an Indian option (alloo puri, dosa etc) American pancakes and then your usual cold items - cereals, toast, croissants, pastries. Location - If you are going to Dubai and you are wanting to be close to Meena Bazaar than this place is for you. It is practically across the road and we went every day. The creek was fairly close too, you could walk there through Meena Bazaar in about 15-20 mins. There are small malls and amenities all around the hotel. McDs and KFC opposite and plenty of other eateries open till early hours of the morning. General – As some other have mentioned, this hotel does mainly cater for Asians as it is Indian owned and run. The club is a little loud and so I am glad we requested a room on a higher floor. We were on the 5th floor and the disco did not disturb us. The swimming pool is a little abandoned and looks rarely used – not very inviting. The beauty salon is expensive, but they are very good. My mum had a full body massage and said it was well worth the money. This is not a top class hotel but I wouldn’t class it as a budget hotel either – we had a very comfortable stay. On the last day we ordered room service – meal for 3 came to around £15...bargain for a hotel and portions were very good. I would stay at this hotel again and also recommend it to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Some will like it, some won't. . .”
Reviews.Author: DohaShredder
Reviews.Content: Ok, lets get to the point. This hotel has nice clean rooms, and pretty decent service, and its located in a decent area - close to Burjuman mall, and numerous shops. HOWEVER, this hotel becomes an all out party scene at night. When you enter the lobby in the latter part of the evening, you're greeted with disco lighting, loud music, and plenty of loose women. In fact, outside the hotel there are plenty of loose women to pick up. OH yes, make sure you get a room on a high floor. . . otherwise you'll hear the thumping music from the club all night. Look the hotel is cheap, I paid like US$65 per night. It comes with ups and downs. . .if you're pretty conservative, I'd suggest staying away. . . but if you don't mind the loud music and loose women, for the price, it might be worth considering.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel! This is a steal!”
Reviews.Author: Mellita_g
Reviews.Content: I was really hesitant to stay at the Regal because of all the negative feedback on the site, especially as a female traveling solo. I rarely take the time to write reviews, but I had to rectify this poor impression. The room was extremely clean. The location was great, near a lot of tourist attractions. Front desk staff was extremely helpful. The buffet breakfast was amazing. There are a number of good restaurants in the hotel. Ok, so it's not the Ritz, but I honestly couldnt believe the price for all I got! This is one of those rare gems...a great value.

Reviews.Title: “great service, and value for money”
Reviews.Author: hamlet_9
Reviews.Content: The service was a pleasant surprise. So was the price. In fact the location is also convenient.

Reviews.Title: “not recommended”
Reviews.Author: lily66
Reviews.Content: The hotel lobby stinks. There is a disco downstairs every night and it is very loud. The room was very dark. The picture seen is othe buildings next to it. The area itself is just dirty and crowded. Dont be fooled by the picture and the price. You would be better off getiing another location in other quite and nice areas. The concierge was also very unhelpful.

Reviews.Title: “It's 'ok' – and that's it.”
Reviews.Author: McLachlan22
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel because it was the only option in the last leg of a business trip and budget dictated this choice. As many of the reviews note, the hotel is merely 'ok'. It covers the basics which we have all now come to expect from international standard hotels: tv, minibar, bathrooms with extra towels, soaps etc. basic cupboard space, small desk and chairs, in-room safe. What made the Regal somewhat different from other hotels in this class (in my experience) is the size of the room - it was really quite large and boasted a king size bed. However, from this point on, things dont look quite as good. Upon arrival, the man at reception did not acknowledge us (I travelled with a colleague) as we stepped up to the counter, nor did he for several seconds afterwards... he just continued his work. With a mouth hanging open (no jokes), he looked up at me and said hello and asked for our booking details in a most matter-of-fact way. The first impression left me tainted. There was just no extra mile attitude and I felt like I was bothering him for the entire stay. The other reception ladies were all from Eastern descent and could not speak English well, so I was often diverted to the 'English speaking gentleman' for queries when calling reception. Things just always felt hard to achieve. My colleague requested a wake-up call and they missed it by 1hr! All service was not bad. I needed the in-room safe opened and this was done promptly and staff was friendly and well spoken. Staff at breakfast was also very polite. Breakfast is served in an extension of the lobby (weird) and is quite tacky really (American Bar at night). There is also an pub in the lobby and it is clearly a local sport hangout as multi-national flags grace both the entrance and the lobby. On the next level there is a club that is extremely loud. Book for floor 7/8 at the very front of the hotel as any other room must surely be blasted by that noise. (i cant actually believe that they alow it to be so loud). Hotel sits in a good neighbourhood, with easy access to Taxi's. The Dubai creek is 10 mins walk away. The building however sits on a large traffic circle that is currently under construction. Dont expect any pretty views. Rooms have old carpets, broken, burnt and dirty in the corners, so if you look close, you'll find ample eeekkk moments. Lastly, the fitness room is fine, but the pool area and "health spa" is just gastly. The creepiest I've seen in a long time. This hotel seems to run on a mix of local support and the need for budget travelers to find accomodation in Dubai (of which there is plenty). If you need budget, you'll survive here, however, stay away if you want views, luxury and something special.

Reviews.Title: “Not good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vinka
Reviews.Content: I book this hotel thrue the agency. I was staying there with my frend.We two were on visitintig tour of DUbai. My complains are this: In the hotel there is night club where are coming many prostitutu. So for the girls can be many uncomfortable situation. I mean we were checked on the receptions many times , and when we wanted to invite our frend in room they didnt give us, but they call security and our frend coudnt come in our room. Stuff is very unfamilier, especcialy to female guess. Also the service is very bad, our towels didnt change regularly, so we had to ask them to change it. The sink in bathroom had a problem so water was coming from the floor whenever we open water. Also two time electricity was gone in 3 days. Breakfast is also bed, and its served almost in the main hall, near reception. What can I say is that for money I payed for the room I think the service is very bad. Afterall the price isnt too small. I woudnt recomend this hotel, because in DUbai you can get for this money better service and better room.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but OK”
Reviews.Author: Roscullion
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week on business. OK but no frills. Good sports bar serves plenty of brands of alcohol including Stella. The bar food was suprisingly very good. Breakfast is poor but I guess OK as it was included in the room rate. Pool is small and doesn't get sun all day. Location is good - I walked to the nearest Mall most nights to eat also walked to the creek.

Reviews.Title: “False advertising on internet-hotel area under construction”
Reviews.Author: couple1
Reviews.Content: No Jacuzzi-Broken, covered in plastic. Looks it has not been used for for long time. No coffee shop. Not suitable for vegetarians. Swimming pool-half full-poor condition, dirty. Bollywood cafe has 6-7 girls dancing on stage every night and men giving them money. Only suitable for batchelors. Internet picture of hotel is false.On internet hotel is next to buildings. These have been demolished and turned into a roundabout with construction work. Bur Dubai is under construction as a railway is being built until end of 2009. Roadworks. Evidence attached in pics. No taxis available in bur dubai. One taxi driver told us that they do not go to bur dubai as it is congested with diverted traffic and due to the building work. Hotel said more than 2 hrs wait for a taxi and will not chase this for you. Hotel has 1 driver for airport transfers but this is not free. 'No easy access to banks, business and shopping'.'Pool is not temperature controlled'. Very congested traffic in Dubai and not a holiday destination. Good fofr shopping only. Bathroom-cracks on floor and tiles. Little holes in the bathroom tub. Toilet seat broken when we arrived. Dvd player not working in room. 'No spa tub or turkish bath'. 'Hotel does not offer a shuttle bus to and from the airport'. 'Taxi is not available 24 hrs a day'. Have to wait more than 2 hrs. Window in room has no lock and is open at all times. Dangerous if on top floor. 'A bus service runs to city centre' Have to wait more than 1 hr due to roadworks. Whole of Dubai is under construction and hotel is located on a roundabout. Would not advice any holidaymakers to visit Dubai until end of 2009. 'No currency exchange'.

HotelInfo.Name: Regal Plaza Dubai
HotelInfo.Address: 1A St | PO Box 55808, Dubai 26843, United Arab Emirates
